title: Iceland is selling a new range of Frozen 2 food - including Olaf potato shapes
text:
Get the biggest money stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

With Frozen 2 set to launch in cinemas next month, it seemed only logical that frozen food giants Iceland got involved.

Iceland supermarkets have just announced that they're launching their very own Frozen 2 food range, complete with breaded chicken shapes, Olaf-shaped potatoes, and of course, Olaf noses.

For anyone missing summer, there's also a selection of ice lollies in the range, plus our favourite item of all: a metre high jumbo Olaf soft toy.

Prices start at just 90p, the entire range is exclusive to Iceland with most of the items already in stores across the country, as well as online on the retailer's website.

The only thing that' not available yet is the Warbutons Wonderloaf - a 50% white and 50% wholemeal flour loaf of good old Warbutons' British bread to help inject a little magic into lunchtimes.

Despite only launching today, the new range has already sparked a lot of excitement with Frozen 2 fans, especially on Facebook page Extreme Couponing and Bargains UK after the group shared a photo of the new additions to the freezer aisles.

One metre giant Olaf, £40

Olaf potato shapes, £1

Giant Christmas cracker, £4

Breaded chicken shapes, £2
description: Frozen food fans Iceland have partnered up with Frozen 2 the movie to launch a brand new range - and there's a lot of Olaf involved
